msDesc.head: Composite alchemical manuscript in Latin and English; 15th-17th centuries

history.provenance: “Liber mei Christopheri Taylour”, fol. 1; fol. 14r, 49r and 66v are inscribed in a similar manner; and at the foot of the first page is written “Joh. . . Bryghtes boke.”
Bequeathed by him to the Ashmolean Museum.
Transferred to the Bodleian Library in 1860.

recordHist.source: Description adapted (Dec. 2022) from the Quarto Catalogue (W. H. Black, A descriptive, analytical, and critical catalogue of the manuscripts bequeathed unto the University of Oxford by Elias Ashmole Esq...., Quarto Catalogues X, 1845), with additional reference to published literature as cited. Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1233–4 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1235–6 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1237–8 Quarto Catalogue, col. 1239 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1140

listBibl.bibl: L. M. Eldredge, The Index of Middle English Prose IX: Manuscripts ... in the Ashmole Collection (Cambridge, 1992) [IMEP]
Dorothea Waley Singer, Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts in Great Britain and Ireland dating from before the XVth Century (1928-1931)

msItem.title: Epistola Bernardi de opere philosophico
msItem.rubric: In nomine Dei amen. Epistola magna Bernardi de opere philosophico sequitur obsequiis
msItem.incipit: Sequitur de compositione furni philosophorum qui dicitur athanor: atque de modo ignis et ejus regimine que sunt principia spectantia ad artem practicam
msItem.explicit: seculorum secula amen
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 319/ii (noting this copy)

msItem.rubric: De vase philosophico
msItem.incipit: Dicit Haly in suo secreto quicunque
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 495/ii (noting this copy); a continuation of the preceding?

msItem.rubric: Lutum sapientie sic fit secundum Albertum
msItem.incipit: Accipe 3 partes argille

msItem.author: Ps.-Arnold of Villanova
msItem.title: De secretis naturae
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Arnowldi de Villa Nova de perfectione operis alkemie, qui quidem vocatur Thesaurus Secretus Operum Naturalium
msItem.incipit: Scito fili quod in hoc libro loquimur de secretis nature
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 229/x (this copy)

msItem.title: Alchemical dialogue
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 383 (this copy only)

msItem.title: Alchemical experiments
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 1111/xciv (this copy)

msItem.rubric: Nota. 5. membra
msItem.incipit: Hijs autem cognitis?
msItem.note: Fols. 6v-10v are treated by Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 300/ii as one item.

msItem.title: Letter of Aristotle to Alexander
msItem.incipit: O Alexander rector hominum
msItem.explicit: et audientes non intelligant

msItem.title: Breviloquium de serpente
msItem.rubric: Opus sub figure
msItem.incipit: R’ serpentem et pone ipsum in curru cum rotis 4or
msItem.explicit: Et scimus quoniam [f. 11a] diligentibus Deum omnia cooperantur in bonum.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de serpente philosophorum sub compendio breviloquii Holkot etc.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 300/ii (this copy)

msItem.author: John Dastin
msItem.title: Compilatio de arte alchemica
msItem.rubric: Opus Johannis Dastyn Anglici de elix’ aquarum ad album
msItem.incipit: Dicit Ortulanus aquas minerales in hoc opere
msItem.explicit: et sic in infinitum
msItem.finalRubric: Deo gratias. Et hic hopus Dastini cujus dicta sunt ex Rosario Arnoldi de Villa Nova, et ex verbis Ortolani, per totum
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 288/iii (this copy)

msItem.title: Alchemical recipes
msItem.rubric: Ad faciendum lunam perfectam ex Mercurio
msItem.incipit: R. vitrioli
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 1111/xciv (this copy)

msItem.title: Ars magna siue Aqua solis
msItem.rubric: Ars magistri Johannis Gallacij
Compositio aquarum, ad solem dissolvendum
msItem.incipit: R’ sal arci sal petre
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 342/iii (this copy)

msItem.title: Vademecum fratri Eliae de ordine minorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus philosophorum quem vocaverunt Thesaurum Absconditum
msItem.incipit: Nota quod per infrascriptam distillationem in igne et sine igne, ab omnibus philosophis occultatam, facere possumus mirabilia
msItem.explicit: cum odore bono. Deo gratias. Explicit.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 172 (this copy listed in corrigenda)

msItem.title: Recepta ad lunam sancti Thomae de Aquino
msItem.rubric: Opus mirabile ad lunam
msItem.note: With other experimenta.
msItem.rubric: Recepta sancti Thome de Aquino
msItem.incipit: R’ merc’ sublimat
msItem.note: With other experimenta.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 185/iii (this copy)

msItem.author: Michael Scot (?)
msItem.title: Ars alchemiae
msItem.rubric: Tractatus Guilelmi Parisiensis ad album sive ad rubeum, procurans ex corporibus immundis veriora luminaria quam sol vel luna naturalis
msItem.incipit: Cum animadverterem nobilem scientiam apud homines penitus denegatam
msItem.explicit: constringendo redit ponderosum corpus.
msItem.rubric: (fol. 17) Opus verissimum ad album, secundum Willelmum Parisiensis
msItem.incipit: Finito opere solis, incipit ad lunam. Fac eodem modo de luna
msItem.explicit: qui trinus et unus vivit et regnat Deus in secula seculorum
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 153/iii (this copy)

msItem.author: Winandus de Rufeo Clipeo
msItem.title: Gloria Mundi
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus libri qui dicitur Gloria Mundi, vel libri Quinque Clavium, sequitur
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini nostri Jh’u Xi et per virtutem ejus, nominatur liber iste Gloria Mundi, et Lux Solis, et Liber Luminum, et Liber Quinque Clavium et Virtutum, et Vis celestis Patris. et Grece dicitur Theologica J. liber divinitatis, et apud Sarracenos dicitur Ysmael .i. Liber secretorum. In hoc triplicem invenies artem et confeccionem hujus lapidis, et dicitur Rebis
msItem.explicit: Et hec dicta sufficiant. Deo gratias. Finite.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 232/ii (this copy)

msItem.author: Ps.-Arnold of Villanova
msItem.title: Semita semitae
msItem.rubric: Jo. Gastebris Theorica
msItem.incipit: Venerande pater gratias ago Deo qui scientiam istam sua propria pietate
msItem.rubric: (fol. 25, margin) Sequuntur quomodo corpora metallorum inducantur in primam materiam, et de elemento aque. Et hoc est eciam opus Arnoldi de Villa Nova in practica. et c.
msItem.incipit: Nunc cum Dei auxilio ad practicam descendamus
msItem.explicit: quam possis recipere ratione
msItem.note: Over this page (28a) is written (by the same hand ?) “Md to enquire for M’ Totyade parsone of Yeldene in com ‘Bedford’ wt in 3 myles of Higham Ferys.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 226/xviii(this copy)

msItem.title: Recipe
msItem.incipit: Reduces aurum in caulcem. R’ acetum

msItem.author: Raymundus Gaufredi
msItem.title: De leone viridi
msItem.rubric: Incipit opus Raymundi de Leone Viridi, editus a fratre Rogero Bacon
msItem.incipit: Rec’ acetwm fortissimum in magna quantitate
msItem.explicit: Elixer vero corporum minus quam spirituum quia tingit nisi centum et c. Deo gratias.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 193/vii (this copy)
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 209C/ii (this copy)

msItem.author: Bernardus Trevisanus
msItem.title: Epistolae ad Thomam de Bononia
msItem.rubric: In nomine Dei incipit epistola magni Barnardi de opere philosophico sequitur obsequiis
msItem.incipit: Obsequiis mihi possibilibus premissis, egregie doctor et domine honorande, noveritis me per nobilem Aldericum de Interminellis [?] de Luca, utriusque amicum predilectum recepisse copiosam litteram vestram
msItem.note: The beginning of this copy so materially varies from that in No. 1406, i. art. 1, as to suggest whether they were not different translations from a French or Italian original. The present copy is unfinished, and ends thus
msItem.explicit: quare vegetabiliter nutrimentum suscipiunt. Lapis autem noster
msItem.note: The next leaf is vacant; and so perhaps was f. 39, which now is lost.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 317/iv (this copy)

msItem.title: Prognostication by the moon
msItem.incipit: Signum Aquarii habet tibiam usque ad inferiorem partem
msItem.note: Ends in Capricorn
msItem.incipit: Tempus dat frigidum et siccum et ventus est prope terrain, et nubes discurrunt per aera sine aqua, et sepe consuevit nebula esse. Explicit omnia.

msItem.title: Lapidis aquae vitae
msItem.rubric: Lapidis aque vite
msItem.note: Designed to fill the four blank pages here, but only 8 lines are written.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 320 (this copy only)

msItem.title: Recipe
msItem.rubric: Ad dentem dolentem sive putridum extrahendum
Ad restaurandum naturam [etc.]
Ad probandum quis habet furatum

msItem.title: Secrets of women ('Secreta quaedam magica, de mulieribus praesertim')
Quaestiones Kalid Regis ad Morienum Romanum
msItem.rubric: In nomine [etc.] Incipiunt questiones Kalid Regis, ad Morienum Romanum
msItem.incipit: Moriene, manifesta mihi magisterium lapidis philosophorum
msItem.explicit: vana et inutilia malum exilum habencia
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 67/v (this copy), covering fols. 47-53v.

msItem.title: Liber gratiae Hermetis siue Aqua vita perhennis
msItem.rubric: Incipit Aqua Vite perhennis
msItem.incipit: In nomine sancte trinitatis amen. Fratres sciam scientiam alkimie investigatores
msItem.note: It ends imperfectly, with this title,-“Nunc de vase sequitur.” After six blank pages, occur the following pieces.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 40/vii (this copy)

msItem.rubric: Opera metallorum in igne perficere, sive alchimie artem exercere
msItem.incipit: In omni illo opere

msItem.title: Astrology ('regulae planetares')
msItem.rubric: In operum electione, secundum varios authores
msItem.incipit: Saturni ☌ cum ☾ dies in omni re pernisiosa
msItem.explicit: et deliciis uti congruit

msItem.title: Prognostication
msItem.rubric: Lunae significationes in 12m signis sodiaci
msItem.incipit: ☾ in ♈︎ balnea salubria reddit
msItem.explicit: cum in signis
msItem.note: On the last page, written by old hands, are, a fragment of an old Song (6 lines, incipit below) aud the following title of a book, “Traicte des chiffres, ou secretes manieres d’escrire, par Blaise De Vigenere, Bourbonnois. A Paris, 1587.”
msItem.incipit: Hey how what shall I saye

supportDesc.foliation: 66 leaves; numbered by an old hand: of which ff. 39, 45-6 (apparently blank) are lost

msItem.author: Johannes de Rupescissa
msItem.title: Quinta essentia
msItem.rubric: Liber quinte essencie.-Primus liber de consideracione quinte essencie omnium rerum transmutabilium. In nomine domini nostri Jhesu Christi. Incipit liber de famulatu philosophie evangelico domini nostri Jhesu Christi et pauperibus evangelicis viris
msItem.incipit: Dixit Salomon Sapientie caº. vijº. Deus dedit mihi horum scientiam veram
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit primus liber qui est de consideratione quinte essencie
msItem.rubric: In nomine [etc.] Incipit liber secundus, qui de generalibus remedijs appellatur
msItem.incipit: Licet primus liber
msItem.explicit: [remedium vicesimum] vel in ejus absentia aqua ardens. Deo gracias.
msItem.note: (With the drawing of a vessel or instrument.) See also No. 1451, i. art. 1.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., no. 292/xxviii (this copy)

msItem.title: Tractatus de septem herbis septem planetis appropriatis
msItem.rubric: Incipit quidam tractatus de vij. herbis, vij. planetis attributis
msItem.incipit: Alexius Affricus, discipulus Belbeis, Claudio Artheniensi epylogiticis studium continuare et finem cum laude. Post eciam antiquorum Kirannidarum volumina
msItem.explicit: [solsequium] cum cerebro pavonis, epileuticos
[saluia] omnem difficultatem anelitus sanat etc.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., App. I K 3/xiv (this copy)

supportDesc.foliation: foliated, partly by the writer, and partly by Ashmole, who continued the numbers through the three following MSS.

msItem.note: Three tables of “Infortunat daies after sundry verie aunchent oppinions of great antiquity,” with remarks. The first is after “th’opinion. of Eliaxnore Stroder;” the others are anonymous.
“The third chapter [and other large passages] of Tho: Norton’s booke,” called the Ordinall of Alchemy. (pp. 1-19.) Ending with the last line of the work, subscribed “Finis. Quod Norton.”
Medicine “For to bringe out the canker in what place hee be,” and nineteen other remedies.

msItem.author: John Bubellus (Bumbules)
msItem.title: Stella alchimiae
msItem.rubric: Stella Complextionis perfecti magisterii vel investigationis lapidis
msItem.incipit: Cum omnium philosophorum documenta
msItem.explicit: mihi indigno et peccatori. Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit libellus vocatus Stella Alkimie, compositus a Johanne Būbulē de Anglia, anno Domini 1384
msItem.note: The margins of this copy, written about the time of Queen Elizabeth, contain notes by Robson, and by an other old hand that added, on the last leaf,- Notes, (1) Why alchemy is called ‘the lower astronomye;’ (2) “Arnoldus de operacionibus et effectibus elementorum (3) “The degrease of the worke.” f. 72a. On the next page are written some notes, by Robson, respecting the ‘worke’ in the following MS., which he probably bound with this.

msItem.rubric: Her begynyth þe secunde boke of John Dastyn
Arnoldus de Villa Nova [addition by Robson]
Arnoldi de Villa Nova philosopher liber dictus Thesaurus Thesaurorum, et Rosarium Philosophorum etc [added title]
msItem.incipit: And þe firste turnyng of elementes. and in þt þe [work ?] is devyded in iiij. governances. þerfor it is made open þe workyng of þe medecyne
msItem.explicit: For it is þe gret yefte of Godd and to whom þt he wol he grantiþ it and doþ it away fro wiket men

subst.del: The Mirrour of Philosofi of M’ John Dastyn her endiþ
subst.add: The Rosarie of Arnoldie de Villanova Grecum

msItem.note: Identified IMEP p. 81 art. 1 as a translation of (Ps.-)Arnold of Villanova, Rosarium, bk. II.

msItem.title: Alchemical verses (15) and commentary

msItem.incipit: Est fons in limis cujus latet anguis in imis

msItem.note:
Commentary includes: Unde quidam philosophus-
Uncia
gallarum, medium sit et uncia gummi,
Et bis vitrioli: superaddas octo falerni.
Hoc faciant omnes incaustum composituri.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 791/viii and cf. 824/xiv (both this ms.)

msItem.author: John Dastin
msItem.title: Visio de dono gratiae
msItem.incipit: Cum omnium natura constancium certus sit effectus generacionis et augmenti, ideo asserimus ex sex planetarum transmutacionem fore necessarium ad invicem: videmus hora solis et lune magno desiderio querere talem visionem. Putavimus nos raptos ante conspectum Antiqui Dierum, et ecce planete venientes
msItem.explicit: Et ecce 1a pars sui mille millia omnium aliorum in verissimum mutavit solem.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Visio magistri Johannis de Sumbletone.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 282/viii (this ms.)

msItem.title: Glossary (synonyma alchemica)
msItem.incipit: Azoc .i. merc’ .i. argentum vivum. Zerfin est quod egreditur de auro
msItem.explicit: Terra fetida .i. sulphur
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 400 (this copy only)

msItem.rubric: Raymondes Curtacōns
msItem.incipit: of the metalles
msItem.explicit: et alibi oone dissolucōn and oon congelacion etc
msItem.note: The title is written over the pages in a large antient hand.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 250/x (as a version of (Ps.-)Ramon Lull, Epistola accurtationis lapidis); IMEP p. 81 art 2.

msItem.rubric: A note or knowlege howe the calcynyd powders and waters shall be put and mixed to gethers
msItem.incipit: Md here in this matter
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 250/x (as a version of (Ps.-)Ramon Lull, Epistola accurtationis lapidis); IMEP p. 81 art 3.

msItem.rubric: A curtacion of Raymond Lylle the great phylosopher, et c.
msItem.incipit: Raymond seith for a trewe conclusion these wordes
msItem.rubric: Anoþer of Raymondes Curtacōns [superscribed]
msItem.explicit: as the upright sterlyng etc
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 250/x (as a version of (Ps.-)Ramon Lull, Epistola accurtationis lapidis); IMEP p. 81 art 4.

msItem.title: Alchemy
msItem.rubric: In ye vertue of allmighti God, Jesu Criste, here I begyne ye grett and royall worke of ye 5a sens of mercurye, acordynge ye worke of mar Arnold of ye Newe Towne. Md here after folowt the worke of the quynta essens of coommen marcury
msItem.incipit: Master Arnolde of the New Towne the great ph’er declarith
msItem.note: The greater part of this article is lost. There is a note at the foot of f. 67b, referring to a continuation of it, at “ye folio 15 countynge forward from this folio 67:” but it is difficult to understand how that could be. The last words of this imperfect piece appear to be-
msItem.explicit: And thus undre the forme aforeseide endyth the operation of the vijth arte F. or scyaunce of þe seid quinta essentia
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 292/xl (as a version of John of Rupescissa, De quinta essentia); IMEP, p. 82, art. 5; eVK2 3526.00

msItem.rubric: The elixer to be made after the worke of M’r Darvelle of Brystowe etc.
msItem.incipit: In the name of God þu shalt distylle a corosyve water
msItem.explicit: And the projection therof is as it is written before
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 366 (this copy only); IMEP p. 82 art. 9

msItem.rubric: The trewe compounde howe that the elixer shuld be made of wyne, after Jhon Corbit
msItem.incipit: In the name of the lyvyng God therto in the begynnyng thou shalt take
msItem.explicit: worke þis blessyd worke
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit the verry trewe elixer of wyne, provide by John’ Corbett etc.
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 1010 (this copy only); IMEP p. 82 art. 10.

msItem.rubric: And nowe for to make the best lime [lune] þt may be made. And also for to mortyfie marcury
msItem.incipit: Thou shalt take thereunto oon unce of lime
msItem.note: With other processes.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 1112/lxv; IMEP p. 82 art. 11.

msItem.rubric: A specialle noticion of philosophy
msItem.incipit: In this specialle noticion it is to be markid - that ther is a myneralle body - callid Venus
msItem.explicit: the very wight of gold etc
msItem.note: Ending (under the title “For to doo a wey the stynckyng and blacknez of lead, and also to bryng hym in to a rede colour,” if it belong to this article.
Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 771 (this copy only); IMEP p. 82 art. 6 ('a collection of seven alchemical recipes').

msItem.rubric: The argumentes of dyverse and many olde ph’ers, wheruppon Raymond Lylle declarede and seide the wordes folowyng
msItem.incipit: Raymonde seide conclusyonally
msItem.note: Ending (in a passage much corrected)-
msItem.explicit: prayse world withoute ende. Amen for cherite etc
msItem.note: Singer, Cat. Alchemical MSS., 250/xi (as a version of (Ps.-)Ramon Lull, Epistola accurtationis lapidis); IMEP p. 82 art. 7.

msItem.rubric: Raimondos eciam dicit quod aqua nostra ex tribus naturis
msItem.incipit: That is to understonde as Reymonde seithe
msItem.explicit: that no sutche persone nor persones
msItem.note: IMEP p. 82 art. 7.

supportDesc.foliation: This MS. consists of three fragments of a large book, foliated by the ancient hand thus, ff. ‘55-68’ (except ff. 65, 66, which are lost), ff. 86-95, and ff. 70-83, as they now stand

msItem.author: George Ripley
msItem.title: Pupilla alchimiae
msItem.rubric: George Riplyes Pupilla Alchemiae [added by Ashmole]
msItem.incipit: Firste understand that the noble philosophor Avicen saith, there is in Saturne
msItem.explicit: Take it if you can [etc.] for ever and ever amen
msItem.note: IMEP p. 83 art. 12
msItem.bibl: Jennifer Rampling, 'The Catalogue of the Ripley Corpus: Alchemical Writings Attributed to George Ripley (d. ca. 1490)', Ambix 57/2 (July 2010), 125-201, no. 27.8 (p. 188) (this ms.); see also no. 1.viii.

msItem.author: Ps.-Ramon Lull
msItem.title: Liber lucis mercuriorum
msItem.rubric: Liber Lucis Mercuriorum Raymundi Lulij
msItem.incipit: Tu fili in virtute Dei omnipotentis accipe unum album clarum odoriferum
msItem.explicit: facere projectionem ut supra. Finis.
msItem.bibl: M. Pereira, The Alchemical Corpus Attributed to Raymond Lull (1989), no. I.47

msItem.rubric: Earthe of earthe
msItem.incipit: Take earthe of earthe, earthes brother
msItem.note: DIMEV 5095.
Immediately followed by DIMEV 4236 as if part of the same work.

msItem.incipit: Take wynde and water, white and grene
msItem.note: DIMEV 5113 (9 lines Engl. 4 Latin.)

msItem.incipit: Lapis in omni re et in omni loco dicitur

msItem.title: Alchemy
msItem.rubric: Liber experimentorum Raymundi vel Totum Continens
msItem.incipit: After that we had by a long tyme exercised our lyfe in seking owte in the worlde
msItem.explicit: and yus our litle boke is accomplisshed, wherefore the name [etc.] moste graciouse mercy. Deo gracias.
msItem.note: Also in Cambridge, Trinity College, O.2.15; eVK2 0761.00; translation of Ps.-Ramon Lull, De intentione alchemistarum (Pereira, op. cit. I.33) (?).

msItem.rubric: Mundus philosophicus de adrop, et nigro nigrius nigro
msItem.incipit: R’ sericon quod aliter vocatur adrop combustum
msItem.explicit: 100 partes ☿ in aurum purum

msItem.rubric: De natura plumbi
msItem.incipit: Est frigidum

msItem.rubric: De Rupescissa
msItem.note: In English and Latin

msItem.rubric: A medicinable oile and moche profitable against all infirmyties wth in mannes body
In Raymondes booke of mercuries

msItem.incipit: The lumynaries being calcyned
msItem.note: Four other processes attributed to Raymond Lull.

history.provenance: Johannes Baildonus clericus est hujus libri possessor. Kepe this booke frome evil persones.

revisionDesc.change: Revised with reference to Quarto catalogue and literature as cited.
